channel.title: Is switching to Vista
channel.description:
I'm planning to switch to Vista from XP. Call me stupid, go for it
But, my computer came with XP, and I want it to become Vista, it says its compatible, and I'm not sure if I should do it.
Is it possible to do it, without a vista disk?
Will I loose all my files?
Why I'm doing it? I want to play halo 2 on the comp.

item.title: Is switching to Vista
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

I don’t know if this is an option, but you can torrent a cracked version of Windows 7, that brute forces a product key, all you have to do is disable the update that checks Windows Key Activation Technologies. If you’re wondering how your computer will run with Windows 7 using the Aero GUI; I have a 6 year old Dell laptop with Windows 7 that runs like it is new, besides the obsolete specifications.

Edit: If you would like the link to this torrent, private message me.

Read full topic

item.title: Is switching to Vista
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Moparisthebest:

As I said already, if his goal is to play halo 2, then he can get a patch for it to play it on XP. He could also probably play it just fine under Linux with WINE. Switching to Vista simply to play Halo 2 would be horribly stupid.

Exactly, just get a patch, and dont fuck up your computer too play halo.

Read full topic

item.title: Is switching to Vista
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:17, topic:377883”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=473767.msg3466170#msg3466170 date=1294914240]

Listen to Mopar, not:

But since your comp cant do that, keep it XP

As he said, if you can run Vista, you can run Windows 7, 7 is actually less tight on your system resources.
Windows 7 is in every way better than Windows Vista.
[/quote]I enjoy system crashes and window freezes. Your argument is invalid.

But seriously, follow the advice given here. If you really can’t get Windows 7, switch to Linux or stick with XP.

How is Linux any good if the main reason he wanted to swap in the first place was to play Halo 2…[/quote]

As I said already, if his goal is to play halo 2, then he can get a patch for it to play it on XP. He could also probably play it just fine under Linux with WINE. Switching to Vista simply to play Halo 2 would be horribly stupid.

Read full topic

ps - I’ve never played halo on the comp so I have no idea what you would use to run it; why do you need Vista or above?

item.title: Is switching to Vista
item.dc:creator: @Acrodox Acrodox
item.description:
@Acrodox wrote:

Never get vista. The only thing you should upgrade from Xp to is WIN 7. But since your comp cant do that, keep it XP

Read full topic

item.title: Is switching to Vista
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

In reality if you can handle Vista, your computer should be able to handle Windows 7…

All you really need is 1 more gig or RAM…

Read full topic

item.title: Is switching to Vista
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

the elve age:

My comp isn’t compatible for windows 7 though.

Yes it is. If it is ‘compatible’ with Vista then it is ‘compatible’ with 7 as well. They even can use the same drivers.

If you are just doing this to play Halo 2 though, you can download a patch online to play Halo 2 on XP. Whatever you do though, don’t switch to Vista, either stay with XP, switch to Windows 7, or, best of all, switch to Kubuntu or some other Linux distro.

Read full topic

item.title: Is switching to Vista
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

I have both XP and 7, I’ve used Vista and I didn’t like it. It runs poorly and it doesn’t organize files the way I like them. I love 7, it’s very compatible.

Read full topic

[/quotI agree with this, linux is a lovely stable open source OS.

and use the disk it would be much safer and easier, if I could I would send you my disk for vista.
